title: Synthetic Recap
body:
SAN ANTONIO (AP) – In the heart of Texas, amidst the echoes of the Alamo, David Robinson delivered a performance for the ages, single-handedly carrying the San Antonio Spurs to a gritty 96-89 victory over the Denver Nuggets.

From the opening tip, this was the Admiral’s showcase. Robinson was an unstoppable force, a whirlwind of power and precision that the Nuggets had no answer for. He attacked the rim with ferocity, hit from mid-range with a surgeon’s touch, and owned the glass at both ends of the floor. When the final horn sounded, the stat sheet told a story of historic dominance: a career-high and franchise-record 51 points, 14 rebounds, and 5 assists. He was not just the best player on the court; he was the entire game plan.

The Nuggets, led by a valiant 25-point effort from LaPhonso Ellis, fought admirably. They traded blows with the Spurs for much of the night, but every time Denver threatened to close the gap, Robinson answered. A thunderous dunk, a silky turnaround jumper, a commanding block—his responses were as emphatic as they were relentless. He was a one-man fortress, repelling every assault.

While the Spurs received solid, quiet contributions from Sean Elliott (15 points) and Avery Johnson (13 points, 8 assists), this night belonged to number 50. Robinson’s 51-point eruption wasn’t just a winning performance; it was a masterclass, a defining moment that etched his name deeper into the NBA’s lore and lifted his team on his broad shoulders to a hard-fought triumph. In a game of ten men, one was a titan.
